runs.comm: a wayward start from the bowler, straying down leg side and swinging past the diving de Kock to go for five wides, that might have brushed the thigh pad actually
this is wider down leg side than the previous one but de Kock manages to collect this time
good length slanting across the right-hander from over the wicket, Shehzad defends from his crease
width outside off stump and Shehzad cuts off the back foot towards third man
a good length ball outside off with some wobble away from the left-hander, Jamshed moves forward and defends confidently
a fuller and straighter ball, Jamshed clips it towards mid-on and yells a series of No's to send his partner back early
pushed firmly towards point where Duminy gets a bit of awkward bounce, the ball bounces up and off his hand on to his nose
a leading edge and luckily for the batsman it lobs over cover point and gos towards the boundary, Duminy is in hot pursuit
his first ball is poor, full and on the pads, Shehzad flicks towards deep backward square and beats Tsotsobe, who gets to the ball but doesn't manage to stop it cleanly
good length outside off, left alone by the batsman
139 kph, hits a good length outside off and seams away quite sharply, the batsman lets it go

he's been squared up and beaten by a corker from Steyn! The ball pitched on a great length on off stump and seamed away from the right-hander, Shehzad was squared up in his crease as he prodded tentatively at it
driven on the up towards point where Duminy makes a great save, diving to his right
shorter length width width outside off and Shehzad cracks it over point to bookend the over with boundaries
Tsotso beats Jamshed outside off stump as he pushes tentatively from his crease at a ball that nips away from the right-hander
steered from the crease towards third man

he's played on! Shehzad tried to run the ball behind point with the angle across him from over the wicket, but the ball had pitched on a good length and nipped back into the right-hander, cramping him for room. He got a bottom edge on to his stumps, also because of the extra bounce
Tsotsobe goes right past the outside edge with one that pitches on a fuller length and slants across the right-hander, Hafeez came forward to drive and was beaten
Hafeez lets the ball go outside off stump this time
a bit too straight this time, allowing Hafeez a tuck off the pads behind square
145.7 kph, on a good length outside off stump. Serious pace. Hafeez stays back, covers his stumps and shoulders arms
nudges the length ball from outside off towards square for a quick single
defended on the off side
that's a fierce bouncer and Jamshed lets it go
a fuller length on leg stump, the ball goes off Jamshed's pads towards fine leg and Tahir gives chase, he dives valiantly and manages to save the boundary
that's a great shot! Hafeez moves forward and across to drive a full ball superbly past mid-on, excellent timing and it's good to see a friendlier exchange between the players
Jamshed steps out and slogs wildly at a short of a length ball, he misses and the ball passes over the stumps, that was a cross-seam delivery from Tsotsobe
good length and straight, Jamshed nudges the ball on the leg side for a single
he lets a good length ball go outside off as it slants across him
moves forward and towards the off side to get closer to the ball as it angles across him and hits it towards extra cover for a single
played from the crease towards point
that's a poor ball, full on leg stump, but Jamshed can't beat short fine leg with his glance
good length around middle and off, Jamshed stays in his crease and pushes towards point
Morkel hits the thigh and appeals for lbw, the umpire decided Jamshed had got some bat on it as he tried to nudge through square
superbly run from Hafeez, he pushed forward to defend towards cover and set off right away, Jamshed also responded immediately. There's a direct hit at the bowler's end but Hafeez is safe
shot! Morkel pitched short and Jamshed was ready, swivelling on the front foot to pull the ball in front of square

he's edged that down the leg side and de Kock dives to his right with one hand to try and take the catch, it bounces just short of him. Jamshed was trying to glance that to the fine leg boundary. De Kock doesn't appeal

would you believe it! He's got a leading edge that flew well clear of point and raced away to the point boundary. The bounce on this pitch and the pace of the outfield is something else. Jamshed was trying to play through square leg
cut to third man for a single to begin Tsotsobe's final over
he's edged that right over the keeper to the boundary. Jamshed tried to pull a short ball from wide outside off stump and got a thick top edge
nudged off the pads towards midwicket
another short ball and this time Jamshed decides not to pull and let the ball go instead
good length angling into middle and leg, Jamshed stays in his crease and plays the ball towards midwicket
that's hit Jamshed on the thigh. Tsotsobe thinks he has a good lbw shout but the umpire says not out. The ball goes off the pad past the keeper to the third man boundary. The impact was too high
played from the crease towards cover
defended on the front foot on the off side

caught and bowled, splendidly! Duminy takes two steps to his right and dives full length to catch the ball with both hands. Jamshed stayed in his crease and pushed tentatively, he ended up chipping it in the air, and Duminy covered good ground to get to it
he gets beaten by one that slides across him from round the wicket, Akmal had pushed forward to defend
a full ball driven to long-on for a single
played back to the bowler, the crowd think it's a catch but it's a bump ball
Akmal leans forward and flicks a full ball towards deep midwicket
tossed up wide outside off stump, driven firmly to long off for a single
punched off the back foot to the bowler
he's cut that from very close to off stump, the length wasn't that short either, but Akmal's managed to make contact late to beat short third man
played uppishly towards the non-striker, Tahir dives to his right but can't reach it
the googly spins sharply into the right-hander, I'm not sure the batsman picked it but he managed to keep it out
flicked off the front foot through the leg side
